API¶

Description of the API of the Custom Bias Generator package.

Classes¶

CTABGAN¶

class custom_bias_generator.CTABGAN(raw_csv_path, categorical_columns, mixed_columns, general_columns, problem_type, **kwargs)¶
__init__(raw_csv_path, categorical_columns, mixed_columns, general_columns, problem_type, **kwargs)¶

CTABGAN (Conditional Table-based Generative Adversarial Network) class for generating synthetic data.

Parameters:

  • raw_csv_path (str) – The file path of the raw CSV data.

  • categorical_columns (list) – List of column names that are categorical.

  • mixed_columns (dict) – Dictionary where the keys are column names and the values are the corresponding mixed types.

  • problem_type (dict) – Dictionary specifying the problem type. The key can be either ‘Classification’ or ‘Regression’. The value is the name of the target variable.

  • **kwargs –

    Additional keyword arguments.

  • num_epochs (int) – Number of epochs for training the synthesizer (default: 10).

  • general_columns (list) – List of column names that are general types (default: []).

  • log_columns (list) – List of column names that are log-transformed (default: []).

  • non_categorical_columns (list) – List of column names that are non-categorical types (default: []).

  • integer_columns (list) – List of column names that are integer types (default: []).

  • test_ratio (float) – Ratio of test data to split from the raw data (default: 0.2).

fit()¶

Fit the CTABGAN model by performing data preprocessing and training the synthesizer.

generate_samples(num_samples)¶

Generate synthetic samples using the trained synthesizer.

Parameters:

num_samples (int) – Number of synthetic samples to generate.

Returns:

DataFrame containing the generated synthetic samples.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

static load(path)¶

Load a saved CTABGAN instance from a file.

Parameters:

path (str) – The file path to load the CTABGAN instance from.

Returns:

The loaded CTABGAN instance.

Return type:

CTABGAN

save(path)¶

Save the CTABGAN instance to a file.

Parameters:

path (str) – The file path to save the CTABGAN instance.

class custom_bias_generator.BiasInjector(data_path, target_label, positive_label_value)¶
__init__(data_path, target_label, positive_label_value)¶

Initialize the BiasInjector class.

Parameters:

  • data_path (str) – The path to the data file.

  • target_label (str) – The label of the target variable.

  • positive_label_value (str) – The value of the positive label.

inject_bias(prior_y: float, n_samples: int, sensitive_attribute_list: list[str], pmf_dict: dict[str, list[tuple]])¶

Inject bias into the data.

Parameters:

  • prior_y (float) – The prior probability of the target positive class.

  • n_samples (int) – The number of samples in the final dataset.

  • sensitive_attribute_list (list[str]) – The list of sensitive attributes.

  • pmf_dict – The dictionary of target values and their corresponding probability mass functions. For example:

>>> pmf_0 = [(['Male'],0.2),(['Female'],0.8)]
>>> pmf_1 = [(['Male'],0.5),(['Female'],0.5)]
>>> pmf_dict = {'<=50K':pmf_0,'>50K':pmf_1}
Returns:

The mutated data with injected bias.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame
